question: Was Joseph Stalin born in an even year?
response:
Joseph Stalin was born on December 18, 1878, according to the Gregorian calendar. However, at the time of his birth, Russia still used the Julian calendar. The Julian calendar was behind the Gregorian calendar by 12 days, so by the Julian calendar, his birthdate would be December 6, 1878. 

Using the Gregorian calendar, 1878 is an even year. However, if we consider the Julian calendar, 1878 is an odd year. 

Therefore, to conclude, if we only consider the Gregorian calendar, Joseph Stalin was born in an even year. However, if we take into account the Julian calendar used in Russia at the time, his birth year would be considered an odd year.
